alert.note: Alert for Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 5:28PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will continue to impact portions of west central El Paso County through 600 PM MDT... At 526 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over southern Colorado Springs, moving east at 25 mph. Thunderstorms will continue to redevelop on the east face of Pikes Peak and move southeast across Colorado Springs. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and brief bouts of up to half inch hail. Rounds of moderate to heavy rainfall will be possible under the stronger cells. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Ponding of water on road surfaces will occur under the stronger storms. Locations impacted include... Colorado Springs, Fountain, Manitou Springs, Stratmoor, Chipita Park, Security, Peterson AFB, Security-Widefield, Cimarron Hills, Cascade and Fort Carson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft
